intro: Lampranthus viatorum, commonly known as the traveler's glory, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is known for its striking, brightly colored flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers, which range in color from red to orange, bloom in late summer to early autumn. Lampranthus viatorum is a short-lived perennial, often used in rock gardens due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
